name: Dynatrace
slogan: AI-powered, full stack, automated performance management
description:
All-in-one performance monitoring

Use a single platform to analyze application performance throughout your application’s full stack, down to each individual transaction across all layers and technologies.

Full stack monitoring provides full insights into customer experience, application performance management, and infrastructure monitoring—including servers, containers, and cloud—end-to-end with no blind spots.

Get the deepest, most accurate, granular tracing of every single transaction.

Our research and development team of more than 600 experts ensures the broadest and deepest coverage of technologies in the industry.

jobs.title: Java Engineer
jobs.description:
Your role in the team:

Backend and API development in Java
Conception of new innovative Features in close cooperation with product managers and software architects
Close interaction in an international development team


We expect:

Several years of experience as a Software Engineer, with in-depth knowledge of java libraries, for back-end processing and API design.
Proven track record in building software, getting projects completed and into production
Passion and pride for what you do
A healthy amount of curiosity, having fun in learning new technologies and tools
Team player with a solid level of quality and pride in your own work, responsible and self sufficient
Taking beers with the team (just sometimes...)


You will love working with us if:

You want to know and use the latest cutting-edge technologies.
Agile development and teamwork using Scrum is a given for you.
You like to have fun also at work and are self-motivated.
Like to bring in new ideas and to convince others to build .

jobs.title: FullStack Engineer (Java + Angular)
jobs.description:
**Java | Angular | Data Visualization | AI-powered | Distributed Systems | Open Source| AI-powered**
  
Interested in joining a global leader that enables digital transformation?   
Looking for teammates who appreciate open communication and face challenges together as a team?  

**Who we are ** 
  
Dynatrace offers the lead in software intelligence product to simplify enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. We offer solutions such Application performance management, Cloud infrastructure monitoring, IT Operations powered by AI and Digital customer experience.

By using Dynatrace solutions, our customers can simplify their enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate their digital transformation.


If Fullstack (**Java/Angular**) is your thing, join our R&D Engineering team and help us develop data visualization components for our product platform applying modern frontend technologies. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact. At Dynatrace, we build our product with performance, scale, and security in mind. 


**Your role in the ream**
* You would join one of ours data visualization development teams
* Design and implement end to end data visualization solutions, UI components and REST endpoints 
* Collaborate with local and international development teams 

**We expect**
* BSC/MSC related to Software Engineering or equivalent 
* 5 years actively working on Angular, TypeScript / Javascript with sound knowledge of componentized UI design and development
* 2 years experience on pure Java development
* Practical knowledge in a professional environment of good software principles 
* Practical knowledge of Scrum, peer programming and other agile good practices 
* Professional experience in developing of SaaS products 
* Experience in usual suspects development tools JIRA, Confluence, Github, Bitbucket 
* You have been improving the quality bar of the teams / companies you have worked with in your career  
* Very good level in English
* Proactive team player with high quality awareness and independent working attitude

**You will love working with us if**
* You enjoy learning new technologies and you are fearless about it
* You enjoy solving difficult engineering challenges 
* You take working with agile methods (Scrum) for granted 
* You appreciate team spirit, like swapping new ideas with your teammates and an international environment is attractive to you**


We offer competitive salaries depending on your experience, life & health insurance, merit based salary increase, training programs,  awesome and international engineering community and more. 
  
We look forward to your application! Do you want to level up? Apply and let's talk!

jobs.title: APAC Field Marketing Director
jobs.description: The Director of Field Marketing is responsible for driving the APAC strategy on how to increase new logo qualified opportunities for our sales organization. This role will lead a talented team of regional marketing professionals across all aspects of demand generation, field marketing and digital marketing in support of the APAC sales pipeline and revenue goals. This is a highly collaborative role also working with Corporate Marketing, Partners, Operations Finance, and HR leadership to ensure alignment.

jobs.title: Account Executive (Chile - Remote Office)
jobs.description:
At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and that’s why customers like Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products.  Our fast-paced Sales team is growing. We’re looking for a highly motivated Account Executive who is a seasoned hunter, experienced in selling software solutions to state and local government and can do so successfully within a designated territory in **Chile and Bolivia**  
 Come be part of one of the fastest growing companies in the Cloud world right now.

At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and that’s why customers like Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products. Our fast-paced Sales team is growing. jobs.title: Account Executive (Inside Sales)
jobs.description:
Here at Dynatrace the Account Executive (ISR) own the entire sales cycle for a specified territory.  This includes developing new customer leads (generated from both outbound prospecting and inbound inquiry), positioning Dynatrace, and closing business on a monthly basis. The Account Executive is expected to develop a territory go-to-market (GTM) plan and execute daily to that plan.  This includes targeting accounts and specific contacts within the account, building relationships with IT and Lines-of-business (LOB), determining business pain and working to map the proper solution and close business.  
***This position will be based at our Global Headquarters in Waltham, MA***

jobs.title: Account Executive (Monterrey- Remote Office)
jobs.description:
We are looking for an Account Executive who is a seasoned hunter and experienced in selling software solutions to executives at either large or small companies (because we help both!). Someone who enjoys getting to know the “ins & outs” of a technology, and then communicating the value it can bring to the marketplace.     
You have proven to operate independently and make timely decisions in an ambiguous, fast-paced environment. Creative, energetic and a self-starter, you are intimately familiar with the enterprise sales cycle and can use solutions-based software sales skills to drive deals forward and compress decision cycles.   
We are looking for a track record of proven sales success and an interest in sharing your expertise with a fast growing team. - Drive revenue by meeting and/or exceeding sales quota - Develop and execute a regional sales strategy, emphasis on net-new accounts - Represent Dynatrace relative to the competition - Own the Statement of Work development - Forecast and report sales activity

Purpose built for today’s enterprises, Dynatrace is the only AI-powered, full stack and completely automated monitoring solution that provides deep insight (answers, not data) into every user, every transaction, across every application. That’s why the world’s leading brands, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to optimize customer experiences, innovate faster and modernize IT operations with absolute confidence.

jobs.title: Account Executive - Nordics
jobs.description:
Who are Dynatrace? Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With AI and complete automation, our all-in-one platform provides answers, not just data, about the performance of applications, the underlying infrastructure and the experience of all users. That’s why many of the world’s largest enterprises, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to modernize and automate enterprise cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences.  
At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and that’s why customers like Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products.  Our fast-paced Sales team is refocusing. We’re looking to fill a newly created position out of growth for a Account Executive reporting into the Regional Director. You will work closely with our top-performing sales team to identify and act on demand for target accounts for our Software Intelligence platform.

jobs.title: Account Executive-Defence/ Intelligence/ National Security
jobs.description: Dynatrace helps Business drive large scale digital transformation programs ensuring the focus is on Customer Experience and delivering value to our customers’ end users. Today, in the application centric world, every digital moment and every touch point is vital to delivering Government and Commercial services and ensuring high reliability and application performance. Dynatrace gives the application insights needed to support Government and Business manage complicated transformational programs and achieve digital success. Industry Analysts have ranked Dynatrace as the leader and global Innovator for eight consecutive years, and we are proud to serve the vast majority of the largest Government digital solutions within Australia and New Zealand, supported by Global reach back and Tier 1 references. This role will be located in our Canberra Office. You will be joining the most successful region in the APAC part of the Dynatrace business.

jobs.title: Cloud Native Microservices Software Engineer
jobs.description: **Are you a forward thinking "technologist"? Looking to develop microservices on business impacting applications? Want to be apart of an energetic and talented team of engineers working on interesting products? Then continue reading!**   **Who we are:** Dynatrace is software intelligence for the enterprise cloud! We have reinvented cloud and application performance monitoring to a full scale with end-to-end visibility of every user, across every application, anywhere in the digital ecosystem. The Dynatrace platform is easy, automatic, AI powered monitoring! Go beyond the standard, try our [demo!](https://www.dynatrace.com/trial/?vehicle_name=https://www.dynatrace.com/)  **What you will be a part of:** The Detroit office is the epicenter for Dynatrace Customer Services. The R&D team in Detroit focuses on “Digital Business”. Digital Business is a combination of platforms, tools and services to deliver an unrivaled, world-class customer lifecycle experience. The software services developed in Digital Business range from the Dynatrace product administration portal, to customer intelligence tools, to various communication and support functions. With these digital services we get deep insights into the customer journey enabling us to offer proactive support and services, identify new business opportunities, drive operational excellence and ultimately ensure customer success. The R&D team focuses on a BizDevOps (Business, Development, Operations) approach to software development that encourages developers, operations staff and business teams to work together so the organization can develop software more quickly, be more responsive to user demand and ultimately maximize revenue.  **Why work at Dynatrace:** Dynatrace provides you with continuous growth opportunities in an environment catered towards learning, creativity and innovation. We pride ourselves on working hard and having fun! With a flat hierarchy mindset, you are enabled to voice your opinions, take ownership, and drive your own success. You will get to work in the heart of Detroit, the next “tech-hub” of the US where you are provided with easy access parking to Ford Field. We have an open, casual office with a heavy sense of community, collaboration and fun. A few perks of our office and Dynatrace can be seen below and check out Dynatrace Life on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dynatracelife?lang=en) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dynatracelife/?hl=en).   **The Role:** The Digital Business development team in Detroit is at a turning point. Currently we are using Java 8, monolithic distributed architectures, and we are looking to make a change for the future. We are in the midst of changing the technologies used, driving true microservices architecture, using the right technologies for the right purpose while automating/stabilizing our cloud infrastructure and deployments. We are looking to move into modern full stack web architecture and development practice including using NodeJS, Angular, Kubernetes and more. As a Cloud Native Microservices Engineer, you will be a key driver on our core Digital Business platform. You will own the end-to-end microservices development, container deployment and continuous improvement on the platform. Be a key decider in which technologies to use while considering the scalablity and capability of that technology's use case. This platform is designed to provide a quick and unique customer experience on the Dynatrace platform for back-office management, user and account management, customer intelligence and more.

jobs.title: Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist
jobs.description: We are seeking an experienced Conversion Optimization Specialist to join our marketing team. As a Conversion Optimization Specialist at our company, you will be responsible for managing, testing and implementing conversion points in the marketing funnel.  A Conversion Rate Optimization Specialist will utilize their understanding of Analytics, UX, and A/B testing to maximize our conversion rates. This individual will spend time working both as an individual contributor and collaboratively with a team. The ideal candidate for this role has a strong digital marketing background (specifically CRO/Analytics expertise), superior communication skills, and a strong desire to learn and grow. Demonstrated, successful optimization testing experience is required.

jobs.title: Federal Account Executive (Remote Office - Washington, D.C. Area)
jobs.description:
The Federal Account Executive will prospect, attain, grow and maintain a specified territory within the Federal Government. Responsible for developing a sustainable product sales pipeline to meet forecasted revenue targets.  
**Territory planning and reporting** : completion of quarterly territory plan, timely and complete weekly sales reporting (both written and verbal reviews). Development of new sales: development of qualified customers, consistent growth of sales funnel, complete customer proposals, conduct onsite customer presentations, negotiate contracts within established price and terms guidelines  
**Selling skills** : complete organizational mapping of all buyers and buying influences, identification of key customer and buyer priorities, use weekly planning to overcome red flags. Daily use of software: document all accounts and customers with contact information and demographics, add all potential sales into opportunities, always have quarterly forecast current

jobs.descriptionHtml:
The Federal Account Executive will prospect, attain, grow and maintain a specified territory within the Federal Government. Responsible for developing a sustainable product sales pipeline to meet forecasted revenue targets.

Territory planning and reporting : completion of quarterly territory plan, timely and complete weekly sales reporting (both written and verbal reviews). Development of new sales: development of qualified customers, consistent growth of sales funnel, complete customer proposals, conduct onsite customer presentations, negotiate contracts within established price and terms guidelines

Selling skills : complete organizational mapping of all buyers and buying influences, identification of key customer and buyer priorities, use weekly planning to overcome red flags. Daily use of software: document all accounts and customers with contact information and demographics, add all potential sales into opportunities, always have quarterly forecast current

Professional sales growth : Actively participate in the quarterly and weekly meetings, be an expert on all Dynatrace software products and have a detailed understanding of competitors

jobs.title: Lead Consultant
jobs.description:
Dynatrace Expert Services (DXS) ensures successful adoption of Dynatrace technologies throughout the software application lifecycle to provide real-time analytics which help our customers proactively avoid performance issues and to rapidly diagnose and resolve problems should they occur.  
The DXS Managing Consultant is a vital member of the team, responsible for both delivery and project management of Dynatrace professional services. The role focuses on ensuring high quality delivery, whether directly or working alongside delivering partners, with the aim of helping customers to maximise the value that Dynatrace delivers, enabling them to deliver high performing applications with first rate customer experience.  
Customer environments will vary widely. Significant performance problems may take down customer applications, creating a high-stress, time-critical working environment. Other situations may need a more measured approach with rigorous change control and approval processes. Regardless, engagements often take place in cross-organizational, highly political, and visible atmospheres so excellent communication and customer management skills, and the ability to constantly make progress and add value while keeping all parties updated on progress, are essential skills.  
Successful DXS Consultants will have a high-tech background with an application focus and will be intuitive problem solvers comfortable in complex environments, seeking a wide variety of challenges to help them grow. A strong understanding of appropriate technologies (described briefly below) are required as this role calls for more than simple product installation and configuration. The successful applicant will be required to develop skills in using Dynatrace technology to help isolate and analyse application performance problems. They will interact with a wide variety of roles both business and IT need to gain mastery of this knowledge along with the ability to communicate clearly, credibly, and confidently.

jobs.title: Lead Data Scientist
jobs.description: **Are you a "data geek”?  Do you have a passion to foster business growth through data?  Want to be a part of an energetic and talented team of “technologist”? Then continue reading!**   **Who we are:** Dynatrace is software intelligence for the enterprise cloud! We have reinvented cloud and application performance monitoring to a full scale with end-to-end visibility of every user, across every application, anywhere in the digital ecosystem. The Dynatrace platform is easy, automatic, AI powered monitoring! Go beyond the standard, try our [demo!](https://www.dynatrace.com/trial/?vehicle_name=https://www.dynatrace.com/)  **What you will be a part of:** Dynatrace has many functional layers from product to business development. Join the team that is driving how we do business at the global level through the leverage of data. This team enables Dynatrace to dynamically change our offerings, licenses, SKUs, and product integration process to ensure we are competitive, scalable and always ready to adapt to for customer success. Our product is continually improving through research and development, this team of “technologists” are no different by generating insights on how we have done business, and how we can continue to do better.  **Why work at Dynatrace:** Dynatrace provides you with continuous growth opportunities in an environment catered towards learning, creativity and innovation. We pride ourselves on working hard and having fun! With a flat hierarchy mindset, you are enabled to voice your opinions, take ownership, and drive your own success. You will get to work in the heart of Detroit, the next “tech-hub” of the US where you are provided with easy access parking to Ford Field. We have an open, casual office with a heavy sense of community, collaboration and fun. A few perks of our office and Dynatrace can be seen below and check out Dynatrace Life on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dynatracelife?lang=en) and [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dynatracelife/?hl=en).  **The Role:** As a Lead Data Scientist, you will be a key driver on pricing, pricing models, decision support tools and more through the use of machine learning and predictive analytics. Own a very high impact through a combination of business know-how, strong data analysis, and use of emerging data technologies to drive strong business results. Empower the data and business teams, create a successful vision for the pricing and sales team and lead the future of business at Dynatrace through data insights.

jobs.title: NORAM & LATAM Partner Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
The Partner marketing manager will be a key member of the rapidly growing Partner organization within Dynatrace. You will be responsible for executing partner marketing initiatives primarily in NORAM and secondarily in LATAM regions with responsibility for planning, execution and reporting of marketing programs, campaigns and events both with/through partners to enterprise accounts.  
  
The emphasis of this role will be driving end-customer demand generation activities with/through Dynatrace partners in alignment with corporate objectives. The role will collaborate closely with NORAM and LATAM Partner Sales Managers, the global partner marketing organization, and regional marketing teams. This is a results-driven role where Marketing Qualified Leads (MQLs), Qualified Sales Opportunities (QSOs), and Partner Deal Registrations (PDRs) are fundamental metrics of success. Reporting and analyzing activities to make recommendations and improvements is critical.  You will be supported by a central Partner marketing team that will share communication, campaign, content, and event best practices, while also providing access to market leading technology platforms to accomplish your goals. ** **

jobs.title: Partner Sales Manager
jobs.description: As a Partner Sales Manager you will be responsible to recruit, develop and manage partner business in a defined geographic region focused on generating incremental, distributed software license and service-related revenue. Within the defined sales region, efforts are focused solely on Dynatrace’s Software Intelligence platform for the Enterprise Cloud.  Responsibilities also include generating interest in the Dynatrace platform by leveraging the partner ecosystem. For both regional and national partners, the objective is to develop strategic relationships through the creation of joint business initiatives and offerings that leverage Dynatrace as a fundamental component of the partner’s business. Partner Managers jointly develop sales strategies with their partners and implement those initiatives by working with local sales teams. Partner Managers are required to travel selectively to meet with partners and sales teams to gain commitment to launch an initiative and ensure successful execution of the established programs.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.description:
**Do you enjoy solving complex design problems? Do you get excited about building extraordinary UX journeys? Do you want to design meaningful solutions to address real problems? Join the Dynatrace team in Gdansk and help us build and improve our world-class product. Become part of our experienced, global product design team and collaborate with our designers in Linz, Barcelona, and Detroit.**  
**About the role** You own the complete UX lifecycle of a  **Synthetic team**. This team develops synthetic tests that help our customers monitor how fast their pages load. Do you like waiting for content to load? Neither does the Synthetic team. Together with The PM and developers that are on-site, you will try to  **understand the problem**  and  **proposed the best solution**. Do  **user tests** ,  **talk to customers** , and  **work with analytics**. Create Information architecture, and user flows and then wireframes and story maps on whiteboards and paper. With the synthetic team, you will never be bored :)   
**Desired skills & experience:** 2+ years of experience in a similar position in a product companyExperience with end-to-end product designPeople-focused design mindsetWillingness to constantly look for ways to refine designs through user feedback (both hands-on user research or A/B testing)Ability to easily articulate product design decisions in English (both written and spoken)Experience with facilitating workshops with developers and stakeholders using tools such as design studios or design sprintsExperience with an Agile/lean team framework and the ability to deliver real value to the product  
**You’ll be responsible for: ** Thriving in a product environment that requires strong analytical skills, independent self-direction, and an aptitude for team collaboration and open communicationTaking ownership of the user experience of the topic your development team is responsible forTaking part in all phases of the development and design process (from understanding the problem, to finding, validating, and implementing the solution, to releasing and analyzing market response) as one of the three major contributors: PM-DEV-UXPlanning with the team, deciding which stories/tasks require your support or review, flagging them accordingly, conducting UX research, analyzing the competition, benchmarking and testing your solutionsBuilding your solutions using the Dynatrace design system (Barista), and helping with maintaining the design systemActing as a UX advocate by showcasing outstanding UX principles and practices to the solutions you design for Dynatrace  
**Important info:** Submit your application with a portfolio. If we're impressed by your work, we’ll invite you to talk about your experience and your portfolio. After that, if everything goes well you will get assignment to do at home. You will present results of your task during the next meeting and based on that we will let you know if you get the job.

jobs.title: Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
Dynatrace is changing the rules of software intelligence, so we’re looking for game-changing people. Big thinkers and doers that constantly push to the next level.  Joining Dynatrace means being part of the team that has gone way beyond Application Performance Management and is defining Software Intelligence for the Enterprise Cloud. Redefining an industry is hard work and it takes focused, dedicated team players. Come get in the game.  
As a product marketing manager at Dynatrace, you will be responsible for driving marketing strategy, messaging, go-to-market plans and sales enablement for one of our product lines. You will be the expert in buyers, their challenges, how they buy and their buying criteria, and will use that knowledge to create and deliver outstanding content, enable the sales team, and to ensure successful and consistent execution of product launches.  
Attention to detail and an eye for quality, along with the ability to grasp and translate technical capabilities into benefits are crucial.  You will collaborate closely across the marketing organization including demand generation, campaign management and field marketing teams to ensure effective and consistent messaging. Selected candidate will work with product management and field sales teams to identify and prioritize messaging, tools and content to support sales and product launch processes.

jobs.title: Product Research Engineer with DevOps background
jobs.description:
**Do you have experience as a Site Reliability Engineer or DevOps engineer? Have you learned through experience how important it is to measure**  ***everything***  **or, more importantly, how essential it is to monitor the**  ***right***  **things? Are you passionate about improving how companies monitor their IT infrastructure? Then this position might be for you.**  
Join our **R&D Engineering** team and help us develop a very large, complex product using cutting-edge data technologies. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact.   
For ten years running, we have been and continue to be the leaders in the [**Application Performance Market**](https://www.dynatrace.com/gartner-magic-quadrant-application-performance-monitoring-suites/?_ga=2.132405966.1516060962.1585909497-962758344.1582044002) ** ** and beyond,  because we create and develop a [**Software Intelligence**](https://www.dynatrace.com/) solution that enables thousands of software companies to deliver the perfect user experience. Now, more than ever, software needs to work perfectly. With Dynatrace, you will make world-changing software.  
**About the role** The team you would apply for exists solely to help other companies monitor all their products and technologies for problems in their production environments, and to clearly identify those problems so their IT operations can seamlessly tackle the issues. To this end, we have built a platform for Dynatrace that provides a way for specialists (like you?) to continuously develop and add the right monitoring capabilities to Dynatrace so we can enable customers to monitor emerging and evolving technologies.  
Are you an expert in any of the following domains: provisioning, CI/CD, Big Data, Cloud, Enterprise Service Bus (ESB), streaming, databases, queues, security? Then Dynatrace could be a great place for you to create solutions that solve domain-specific customer problems. There are many technologies in those domains, which is why we are building a dedicated team that can accept the challenge. The team will create the next set of plugins to broaden the spectrum of technologies we monitor and help our customers operate smoothly.  
Does that sound like you?  
Be aware that this is *not* a DevOps or Site Reliability Engineer position - there will be no "on call" and no emergency calls! In this position, you work to prevent such fires by developing the right tools.  
**What you'll be responsible for** Research and prototype what technologies are the most needed and brainstorm with our product management team on what to choose nextResearch what is important for a given technology and define what should be the MVP plugin solutionDrive cross-team collaboration to achieve the right solution for the customersWrite the plugin in Python, and then test, document, and release itWin fame  
**Desired skills and experience** Experience with and understanding of the challenges that enterprises face in the area of daily IT infrastructure operationsCommitment to understand and monitor our customers' specific needsDemonstrated full-product thinking The desire to do a lot of comprehensive technology research to understand what is neededDeveloper experience in Python or other programming language (and if you aren't a Python expert, we would help you ramp up)Very good teamwork and interpersonal skills (in English: written and oral)Experience in giving presentations/talks would be a plus  
We thrive on our skills and knowledge and act as a team of people where everyone can perform in their area of excellence. It is not in our DNA to hire smart people and then tell them what to do.   
We want someone who is ready to work in a start-up-like situation in which they own development from idea to solution.   
**Seeing is believing. Check out the Dynatrace ** [**free trial**](https://www.dynatrace.com/trial/?vehicle_name=https://www.dynatrace.com/) **.**

jobs.title: Product Specialist
jobs.description: Are you looking for a fast-paced environment where you can blend your technical curiosity and experience with your passion for helping others (in this case, our customers) succeed in overcoming some of their biggest digital transformation challenges?  If so, look no further.  We want to talk to you! The world needs perfect software and Dynatrace works with some of the world’s leading brands to deliver this, including Adobe, Samsung, Verizon, Starbucks, Virgin Money, Ford, and Experian.  Our Dynatrace ONE team takes the core principles of Agile software development and applies them to delivering amazing customer experience to these and our other 2,000+ customers around the world.  We bring together customer success, customer service, and technical consulting disciplines into cross-functional “squads” with a single focus—to make our customers successful. As a Product Specialist, you will use your product and industry expertise to accelerate product adoption, drive user satisfaction, and provide strategic consulting to our customers. This is done primarily through providing in-product assistance (chat), personalized coaching sessions, and product onboarding. Through these customer engagements, you will have the opportunity to educate our customers about our latest product enhancements and how to get they can the most value from them. Since Dynatrace ONE is embedded into our product, you will be the voice of our product as well as provide the voice of the customer to product management, Sales, and Dynatrace leadership teams. We would also love you to join us at local conferences and meet-ups to share how our automated, full-stack, AI-powered monitoring platform is helping our customers lead in their industries.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.description:
Are you a world class Sales Engineer? Do you love to blend your strong interpersonal and selling skills with a passion for cutting edge technology? Are you passionate and enthusiastic about making customers successful and never hesitate to challenge the status quo.? No problem, Dynatrace has a history of making technical pioneers like you into high-powered SE’s.  
Imagine being able to do the best work you’ve ever done as a Sales Engineer for a high growth, well run and financially stable technology company that is continually identified as one of the best and most innovative technology companies.  
We are looking for Sales Engineers who have a strong background in selling SaaS solutions and understand all phases of the sales cycle and can partner with our field team to drive high sales growth across APAC. You are comfortable engaging early in a deal to help set sales strategy, understand how to lead discovery, craft a solution to solve a customer’s business need, and get deep in validating how Dynatrace’s solutions address that need in real time. Additionally, you should be able to understand a customer’s IT infrastructure and software architecture.

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.description:
**Who are Dynatrace?** Dynatrace makes it easy and simple to monitor and run the most complex, hyper-scale multi-cloud ecosystems. Purpose built for today’s enterprises, Dynatrace is the only AI-powered, full stack and completely automated monitoring solution that provides deep insight (answers, not data) into every user, every transaction, across every application. That’s why the world’s leading brands, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to optimize customer experiences, innovate faster and modernize IT operations with absolute confidence.   **Why Dynatrace?** Dynatrace is leading the way in the APM space, has innovative and exciting solutions to combat the performance challenges of today and are looking for innovative people to join our team.  
**What’s the role?** As a Dynatrace Sales Engineer, you will be a key member of the Dynatrace sales engine and will be responsible for providing excellent technical support to the sales team. You will be the expert on Dynatrace and all things APM. Within this exciting role, you will responsible for executing great demo’s which demonstrate Dynatrace unique approach in solving the customer’s pain, executing and managing POCs onsite, building key relationships with Dynatrace’s customers and completing RFIs & RFPs. You will also work across teams including Dynatrace’s innovation labs, Dynatrace’s Expert Services consultants, CSMs and marketing.  
**About you:** To ensure your success as a Sales Engineer at Dynatrace, you need to be an ambitious, confident and self-motivated individual, with previous SE experience or another technical customer facing role. You need to be passionate about innovative technology, technical sales and articulating value to customers and prospects. In addition, we are also looking for:  
An excellent team player, with the ability to work across all disciplines.Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to communicate technical value into business value.Previous 3 – 5 years of experience working with Java, .NET, PHP or JavaScript languages and are knowledgeable around web technologies as well as SQL.Ability to understand the IT problems and concerns of Federal Customers and demonstrate how the Dynatrace platform can address these needs.Troubleshoot technical issues during evaluations in environments that may have security constraints.Experience and knows the way around typical OS’s including Windows & Linux.Ability to troubleshoot technical issues to produce a working outcome and be able to manage this process.Ability to manage a number of project simultaneously, work with a number of different sales people and support other SEs where needed.Must have a strong desire to grow professionally, adapt to an ever-changing environment and are coachable.Must be able to travel up to 30-35% of the time

That’s why the world’s leading brands, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to optimize customer experiences, innovate faster and modernize IT operations with absolute confidence. Dynatrace is leading the way in the APM space, has innovative and exciting solutions to combat the performance challenges of today and are looking for innovative people to join our team. ** **** What’s the role?**As a Dynatrace Sales Engineer, you will be a key member of the Dynatrace sales engine and will be responsible for providing excellent technical support to the sales team.  You will be the expert on Dynatrace and all things APM.  Within this exciting role, you will responsible for executing great demo’s which demonstrate Dynatrace unique approach in solving the customer’s pain, executing and managing POCs onsite, building key relationships with Dynatrace’s customers and completing RFIs & RFPs.  You will also work across teams including Dynatrace’s innovation labs, Dynatrace’s Expert Services consultants, CSMs and marketing.

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive
jobs.description:
Who are Dynatrace? Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With AI and complete automation, our all-in-one platform provides answers, not just data, about the performance of applications, the underlying infrastructure and the experience of all users. That’s why many of the world’s largest enterprises, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to modernize and automate enterprise cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences.  
At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and that’s why customers like Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products.  Our fast-paced Sales team is refocusing. We’re looking to fill a newly created position out of growth for a Sales Development Representative reporting into the EMEA Sales Development Representative Manager. You will work closely with our top-performing sales team to identify and act on demand for target accounts for our Software Intelligence platform.

jobs.title: Senior Financial Analyst
jobs.description: The Senior Financial Reporting Analyst will use their accounting experience to assist in the preparation of the Company’s consolidated financial results and financial statements. They will be responsible for assisting with the preparation and filing of all external financial reporting documents and related SEC filings, preparing schedules associated with the quarterly review and annual audit, and assisting with the creation and maintenance of SOX controls. The position does not have any direct reports and reports directly to Manager of Financial Reporting.

jobs.title: Senior Java Product Engineer
jobs.description:
**We believe the world needs software to work perfectly. The Dynatrace Software Intelligence solution accelerates our customers' digital transformation and simplifies enterprise cloud complexity through state-of-the-art application performance management, cloud infrastructure monitoring, IT Operations powered by AI, and digital user experience management. With Dynatrace, you will make world-changing software.**  
**About the role** We are looking for skilled and sharp-witted Senior Software Engineers who really love delivering products and want to delve into  **performance — if you like the sound of that, then Dynatrace is the place for you!**  
For ten years running, we have been and continue to be the leaders in the **[Application Performance Market](https://www.dynatrace.com/gartner-magic-quadrant-application-performance-monitoring-suites/?_ga=2.132405966.1516060962.1585909497-962758344.1582044002)** and beyond,  because we create and develop a **[Software Intelligence](https://www.dynatrace.com/) **solution that enables thousands of software companies to deliver the perfect user experience.  **Now, more than ever, software needs to work perfectly.**    
If Java is your thing, join our  **R&D Engineering team**  and help us develop a very large, complex product using cutting-edge data technologies. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact. At Dynatrace, we build our product with performance, scale, and security in mind.   
**You’ll be responsible for ** Continuously building upon and improving the Dynatrace product Designing, implementing, and testing new featuresProactively improving product and code qualityEngaging in building the product roadmap Advocating focus on performance, scalability, and security Resolving customer problems together with the support team Sharing knowledge  
**Desired skills & experience ** Strong product mindset Solid Java knowledge, professional experience in development and architectural designExperience with test-driven development, clean code, design patterns, etc.Solid foundation in object-oriented programming, data structures, and algorithmsAbility to perceive functionalities from a global end-to-end perspectiveExperience in developing distributed and multi-tier web applicationsGood English communication skillsExcellent problem-solving skillsGreat team-player skills Analytical thinking   
**Nice to have ** Hands-on experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Working knowledge of Agile methodologies (Scrum)Experience with newer Java standardsExperience with Angular is a big plus  
We like our new colleagues to be passionate about their engineering craft. Gdańsk Lab is a place where you'll apply your inquisitive approach in a collaborative manner, no matter the task, to solve complex real problems on a daily basis. We’re committed to a nurturing environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to take care of performance, because the world needs software that works perfectly.   
It is not in our DNA to hire smart people and tell them what to do. We thrive on our skills and knowledge and act as a team of people where everyone can perform in their area of excellence.  
Come by \>\> get to know us \>\> decide!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We believe the world needs software to work perfectly. The Dynatrace Software Intelligence solution accelerates our customers' digital transformation and simplifies enterprise cloud complexity through state-of-the-art application performance management, cloud infrastructure monitoring, IT Operations powered by AI, and digital user experience management. With Dynatrace, you will make world-changing software.

About the role We are looking for skilled and sharp-witted Senior Software Engineers who really love delivering products and want to delve into performance — if you like the sound of that, then Dynatrace is the place for you!

For ten years running, we have been and continue to be the leaders in the Application Performance Market and beyond, because we create and develop a Software Intelligence *solution that enables thousands of software companies to deliver the perfect user experience. *Now, more than ever, software needs to work perfectly.

If Java is your thing, join our R&D Engineering team and help us develop a very large, complex product using cutting-edge data technologies. With our broad mission and massive scale, there are countless opportunities to make an impact. At Dynatrace, we build our product with performance, scale, and security in mind.

*You’ll be responsible for * Continuously building upon and improving the Dynatrace product Designing, implementing, and testing new featuresProactively improving product and code qualityEngaging in building the product roadmap Advocating focus on performance, scalability, and security Resolving customer problems together with the support team Sharing knowledge

*Desired skills & experience * Strong product mindset Solid Java knowledge, professional experience in development and architectural designExperience with test-driven development, clean code, design patterns, etc.Solid foundation in object-oriented programming, data structures, and algorithmsAbility to perceive functionalities from a global end-to-end perspectiveExperience in developing distributed and multi-tier web applicationsGood English communication skillsExcellent problem-solving skillsGreat team-player skills Analytical thinking

*Nice to have * Hands-on experience with cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Working knowledge of Agile methodologies (Scrum)Experience with newer Java standardsExperience with Angular is a big plus

We like our new colleagues to be passionate about their engineering craft. Gdańsk Lab is a place where you'll apply your inquisitive approach in a collaborative manner, no matter the task, to solve complex real problems on a daily basis. We’re committed to a nurturing environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to take care of performance, because the world needs software that works perfectly.

It is not in our DNA to hire smart people and tell them what to do. We thrive on our skills and knowledge and act as a team of people where everyone can perform in their area of excellence.

Come by >> get to know us >> decide!

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer (Java) Master Data Cruncher
jobs.description:
Java has evolved tremendously in the past few years especially in performance and scale for large scale data processing.   
Are you checking your patterns for data processing efficiency?  
Are you going over and over the code to check for thread safety?   
Do you use 'finally' much or debate it?   
Are you having fun squeezing the maximum out of GC, experimenting the data structures to get max performance?   
Can't wait to use J9 modules and testing how the new linker gets you more juice?   
We are crunching data for a living at Dynatrace and offer a vast playground for those having fun with it.  
If you like to quickly hack something together to try out things ('just gimme a minute') but at the same time are also keen to write super robust production code that never breaks ('not on my shift'), we would be interested to meet you.If you have fun looking at complex interconnected technologies, solving nontrivial problems in an innovative, elegant way, or sifting through very high dimensional data and displaying it such that it remains intuitive, we want to meet you even more. We love to learn from you as we hope you would like to learn what we have to offer.  
What we do in Barcelona New LAB   
Session Replay which allows organizations to play back unique web or mobile sessions in a “movie-like” experience, providing an end-to-end record of the customer journey from the user’s perspective. Session Replay joins Dynatrace’s Real User and Synthetic Monitoring capabilities to extend the company’s all-in-one digital experience management offering.

jobs.title: Senior Technical Product Manager
jobs.description:
**Are you ready to take big software ideas from inspiration to market leadership? We need someone with a deep understanding of modern Apps, Infrastructure Ops, and DevOps, someone well-grounded in enterprise software and SaaS. More than that, we need someone who is fearless and driven by results. Are you such a person?**  
**About the role** In partnership with our Agile engineering department, you will drive our roadmap with us and define the product's functional composition. Working closely with customers and market analysts, you will understand industry trends, validate product features, and run early access programs. As our ideal candidate, you are driven, fearless, and ready to help us carry ideas from the spark of inspiration to market leadership. You exhibit a deep understanding of modern Apps, Infrastructure Ops, and DevOps, and you are well-grounded in enterprise software and SaaS. Like us, you are fast-paced, determined, and full of ideas.  
**Desired skills & experience:** 5+ years of product management experience, with prior success in setting product strategy and executing it based on research, data and industry trends.Strong understanding of technology platforms, ideally enterprise software and SaaS solutions.A special combination of strong leadership skills, initiative, and team player capabilities, including the ability to lead via influence, patience and determination.Deep understanding of software development in a team, and a track record of shipping great software on time.Understanding of relation between customer experience, partner ecosystem and product success.Excellent problem-solving, organizational and analytical skills.Understanding of relation between customer experience, partner ecosystem and product success.Excellent written and verbal communication skills suitable for working with top-level executives and end users as well as with sales and engineering teams.  
**You’ll be responsible for:** Contributing to the product roadmap definition and being integral to forming our near-term and long-term product strategy.Conducting market research and competitive analysis to help determine product direction.Discovering new product opportunities by combining customer feedback and analysis to identify areas where we can leverage our core technologies, strengths, and market leadership.Understanding customer problems and, working with our Agile international development teams, provide impressive solutions while maintaining our business and engineering balance.Taking ownership for outcomes - working the critical path proactively, anticipating risks, and developing appropriate mitigation plans.Meeting customers face to face as a product expert at events and user conferences.

About the role In partnership with our Agile engineering department, you will drive our roadmap with us and define the product's functional composition. You exhibit a deep understanding of modern Apps, Infrastructure Ops, and DevOps, and you are well-grounded in enterprise software and SaaS. jobs.title: Software Engineer for Cloud Application Readiness (m/f)
jobs.description:
You enjoy trying out new software testing approaches or tools. You like to be part of a highly technical team to extend our Cloud Application Readiness Tooling, which is used in Dynatrace R&D globally. You want to help us enabling our development teams to keep the pace in our rapid growth, then 'CARPE diem'. As part of our CARPE (=Cloud Application Readiness Peer Enablement) team.  
Who we are: Dynatrace is a leading software product company founded in Linz, Austria with more than 2,000 employees worldwide.Our vision: We believe the world needs software to work perfectly.What we do: Software Intelligence to simplify enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation.How we do it: Application performance management, Cloud infrastructure monitoring, IT Operations powered by AI and Digital customer experience.

jobs.title: Software Product Manager (m/f) - Legal and Data Privacy
jobs.description: Dynatrace – the leader in global software intelligence - makes our customers software for ** millions of people ** function more perfectly. In our  **today's digital world** , we also aim for being the best company  **driving innovative data privacy related functionality**  into our platform.   Your job is a  **creative**  one, a software product and service shaping one,  **far beyond just legal advice**. It is to take ownership for all  **privacy related product functionality**. You  **assess privacy risks, ** design and develop  **sales and customer risk evaluation and protection tools** , understand the  **legal framework and technical implementations**  and help our product teams to  **develop pragmatic solutions**  to create a product that finds a perfect balance between protecting our users privacy and delivering value to our customers. If you are up for this challenge, we are excited to meet you!  Our  **unique SaaS approach**  allows us to own the  **Enterprise Cloud Market**  and provide an outstanding customer experience. Thanks to our  **constant strive for innovation**  in product and services, we enable our customers like Apple, Delta Airlines, SAP, United Health Care, JP Morgan and many others to drive their digital businesses with ease.
jobs.descriptionHtml: Dynatrace – the leader in global software intelligence - makes our customers software for ** millions of people ** function more perfectly. In our today's digital world , we also aim for being the best company driving innovative data privacy related functionality into our platform. Your job is a creative one, a software product and service shaping one, far beyond just legal advice. It is to take ownership for all privacy related product functionality. You assess privacy risks, ** design and develop **sales and customer risk evaluation and protection tools , understand the legal framework and technical implementations and help our product teams to develop pragmatic solutions to create a product that finds a perfect balance between protecting our users privacy and delivering value to our customers. If you are up for this challenge, we are excited to meet you! Our unique SaaS approach allows us to own the Enterprise Cloud Market and provide an outstanding customer experience. Thanks to our constant strive for innovation in product and services, we enable our customers like Apple, Delta Airlines, SAP, United Health Care, JP Morgan and many others to drive their digital businesses with ease.

jobs.title: Strategic Account Manager - Benelux
jobs.description:
Who are Dynatrace? Dynatrace provides software intelligence to simplify enterprise cloud complexity and accelerate digital transformation. With AI and complete automation, our all-in-one platform provides answers, not just data, about the performance of applications, the underlying infrastructure and the experience of all users. That’s why many of the world’s largest enterprises, including 79 of the Fortune 100, trust Dynatrace to modernize and automate enterprise cloud operations, release better software faster, and deliver unrivalled digital experiences.  
At Dynatrace, our drive for innovation is unparalleled, and that’s why customers like Delta, SAP and others succeed with our products.  Our fast-paced Sales team is refocusing. We’re looking to fill a newly created position out of growth for a Account Executive reporting into the Regional Director. You will work closely with our top-performing sales team to identify and act on demand for target accounts for our Software Intelligence platform.

jobs.title: Technical Consultant- DynatraceOne
jobs.description:
Are you looking for a fast-paced environment where you can blend your technical curiosity and experience with your passion for helping others (in this case, our customers) succeed in overcoming some of their biggest digital transformation challenges?  If so, look no further.  We want to talk to you! The world needs perfect software and Dynatrace works with some of the world’s leading brands to deliver this, including Adobe, Samsung, Verizon, Starbucks, Virgin Money, Ford, and Experian.  Our Dynatrace ONE team takes the core principles of Agile software development and applies them to delivering amazing customer experience to these and our other 2,000+ customers around the world.  We bring together customer success, customer service, and technical consulting disciplines into cross-functional “squads” with a single focus—to make our customers successful.  
As a technical consultant in our DynatraceOne team, you will use your product and industry expertise to accelerate product adoption, drive user satisfaction, and provide strategic consulting to our customers.  This is done primarily through providing in-product assistance (chat), customized coaching sessions, and product onboarding.  Through these customer engagements, you will have the opportunity to educate our customers about our latest product enhancements and how to take most value from them.  
  Since Dynatrace ONE is embedded into our product, you will be the voice of our product as well as provide the voice of the customer to our product management and Dynatrace leadership teams.  We would also love you to join us at local conferences and meet-ups to share how our automated, full-stack, AI-powered monitoring platform is helping our customers lead their industries.

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.description: As a Technical Support Engineer (TSE) you will be part of our Global Customer Support team. You will use your product, troubleshooting, and people skills to work directly with our customers, resolving technical issues and problems that occur while using the Dynatrace platform. Our customers represent some of the world’s largest companies, and the production applications you will be working on can easily represent millions of dollars per day of revenue. You will drive the assessment and triaging of issues and work efficiently to develop resolutions or interim solutions. You should be comfortable with focused, heads-down analysis of complex technical problems as well as with the interruptions that occur naturally in an operational support environment. For example, you may find yourself assisting other internal teams as they answer questions and provide assistance to customers in real-time (Chat) or via tickets. Some of the issues that you work on will need escalation into R&D. In those cases, you will document information gathered and progress made to date, and then work closely with R&D towards the final resolution. You will regularly and routinely interact with customer personnel at various technical and managerial levels for information gathering, troubleshooting, configuration, status updates, and final remediation.
